page.title: 09CHURCHES OF HURWORTH PLACE.
page.content: St. Cuthbert's Church is the Roman Catholic Church in the grounds of St. Cuthbert's Hospital. People from Hurworth, Croft and from other surrounding villages, as well as from Darlington, attend services here. Ill people from the hospital who are Catholic also go to the services. The building is quite big and very nice. There is a steeple that looks like a rocket. There are lots of Brothers of the Hospitaller Order of St. John of God who make sure that the service is a success. Many people enjoy the services at this very friendly church. The Christadelphian Hall is also situated in Hurworth Place. There are three services each Sunday and a Bible Reading Meeting each Tuesday. The congregation mainly come from Darlington.
